conclusion: Calculate induced current, magnetic force, and frictional force to keep wire frame stationary.
Wire frame is square with side length 0.2 m, half in magnetic field.
Area of wire frame in magnetic field is 0.02 m^2.
Magnetic induction intensity B varies with time as B = 3 + 2t T.
Magnetic flux through wire frame is 0.06 + 0.04t Wb.
Induced EMF given by Faraday's law: E = -dPhi/dt.
Total resistance of wire frame is 4 Ohm.
Induced current in wire frame is 0.01 A.
Magnetic force acts on two vertical sides in magnetic field.
Magnetic force on wire: F = I * l * B.
At t = 2.5 s, magnetic induction intensity B is 8 T.
Magnetic force on each vertical side is 0.016 N.
Wire frame remains stationary, frictional force balances net force.
Magnetic force on side AF pushes wire frame to the right.
Frictional force direction is to the left.
Magnitude of frictional force is 0.016 N.
